member.name: T:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl
member.summary: The ZedGraphControl class provides a UserControl interface to the class library. This allows ZedGraph to be installed as a control in the Visual Studio toolbox. You can use the control by simply dragging it onto a form in the Visual Studio form editor. All graph attributes are accessible via the property.
member.author: John Champion revised by Jerry Vos

member.name: M:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.CopyEmf(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Special handler that copies the current image to an Emf file on the clipboard.
member.remarks: This version is similar to the regular method, except that it will place an Emf image (vector) on the ClipBoard instead of the regular bitmap.
member.param: boolean value that determines whether or not a prompt will be displayed. true to show a message of "Image Copied to ClipBoard".

member.name: M:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.ClipboardCopyThreadEmf
member.summary: A threaded version of the copy method to avoid crash with MTA

member.name: M:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.MenuClick_SaveAs(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Handler for the "Save Image As" context menu item. Copies the current image to the selected file.

member.name: M:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.SaveAs
member.summary: Handler for the "Save Image As" context menu item. Copies the current image to the selected file in either the Emf (vector), or a variety of Bitmap formats.
member.remarks: Note that and methods are provided which allow for Bitmap-only or Emf-only handling of the "Save As" context menu item.

member.name: M:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.SaveAs(System.String)
member.summary: Copies the current image to the selected file in Emf (vector), or a variety of Bitmap formats.
member.param: Accepts a default file name for the file dialog (if "" or null, default is not used)
member.returns: The file name saved, or "" if cancelled.
member.remarks: Note that and methods are provided which allow for Bitmap-only or Emf-only handling of the "Save As" context menu item.

member.name: M:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.SaveAsBitmap
member.summary: Handler for the "Save Image As" context menu item. Copies the current image to the selected Bitmap file.
member.remarks: Note that this handler saves as a bitmap only. The default handler is , which allows for Bitmap or EMF formats

member.name: M:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.SaveAsEmf
member.summary: Handler for the "Save Image As" context menu item. Copies the current image to the selected Emf format file.
member.remarks: Note that this handler saves as an Emf format only. The default handler is , which allows for Bitmap or EMF formats.

member.name: M:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.SaveEmfFile(System.String)
member.summary: Save the current Graph to the specified filename in EMF (vector) format. See for public access.
member.remarks: Note that this handler saves as an Emf format only. The default handler is , which allows for Bitmap or EMF formats.

member.name: M:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.MenuClick_ShowValues(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Handler for the "Show Values" context menu item. Toggles the property, which activates the point value tooltips.

member.name: M:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.MenuClick_RestoreScale(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Handler for the "Set Scale to Default" context menu item. Sets the scale ranging to full auto mode for all axes.
member.remarks: This method differs from the method in that it sets the scales to full auto mode. The method sets the scales to their initial setting prior to any user actions (which may or may not be full auto mode).

member.name: M:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.RestoreScale(ZedGraph.GraphPane)
member.summary: Handler for the "Set Scale to Default" context menu item. Sets the scale ranging to full auto mode for all axes.
member.remarks: This method differs from the method in that it sets the scales to full auto mode. The method sets the scales to their initial setting prior to any user actions (which may or may not be full auto mode).
member.param: The object which is to have the scale restored

member.name: M:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.MenuClick_ZoomOut(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Handler for the "UnZoom/UnPan" context menu item. Restores the scale ranges to the values before the last zoom or pan operation.

member.name: M:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.ZoomOut(ZedGraph.GraphPane)
member.summary: Handler for the "UnZoom/UnPan" context menu item. Restores the scale ranges to the values before the last zoom, pan, or scroll operation.
member.remarks: Triggers a for any type of undo (including pan, scroll, zoom, and wheelzoom). This method will affect all the objects in the if or is true.
member.param: The primary object which is to be zoomed out

member.name: M:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.MenuClick_ZoomOutAll(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Handler for the "Undo All Zoom/Pan" context menu item. Restores the scale ranges to the values before all zoom and pan operations
member.remarks: This method differs from the method in that it sets the scales to their initial setting prior to any user actions. The method sets the scales to full auto mode (regardless of what the initial setting may have been).

member.name: M:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.ZoomOutAll(ZedGraph.GraphPane)
member.summary: Handler for the "Undo All Zoom/Pan" context menu item. Restores the scale ranges to the values before all zoom and pan operations
member.remarks: This method differs from the method in that it sets the scales to their initial setting prior to any user actions. The method sets the scales to full auto mode (regardless of what the initial setting may have been).
member.param: The object which is to be zoomed out

member.name: F:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl._masterPane
member.summary: This private field contains the instance for the MasterPane object of this control. You can access the MasterPane object through the public property . This is nulled when this Control is disposed.

member.name: F:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl._isShowPointValues
member.summary: private field that determines whether or not tooltips will be displayed when the mouse hovers over data values. Use the public property to access this value.

member.name: F:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl._isShowCursorValues
member.summary: private field that determines whether or not tooltips will be displayed showing the scale values while the mouse is located within the ChartRect. Use the public property to access this value.

member.name: F:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl._pointValueFormat
member.summary: private field that determines the format for displaying tooltip values. This format is passed to . Use the public property to access this value.

member.name: F:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl._isShowContextMenu
member.summary: private field that determines whether or not the context menu will be available. Use the public property to access this value.

member.name: F:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl._isShowCopyMessage
member.summary: private field that determines whether or not a message box will be shown in response to a context menu "Copy" command. Use the public property to access this value.
member.remarks: Note that, if this value is set to false, the user will receive no indicative feedback in response to a Copy action.

member.name: F:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl._isPrintScaleAll
member.summary: private field that determines whether the settings of and will be overridden to true during printing operations.
member.remarks: Printing involves pixel maps that are typically of a dramatically different dimension than on-screen pixel maps. Therefore, it becomes more important to scale the fonts and lines to give a printed image that looks like what is shown on-screen. The default setting for is true, but the default setting for is false.
member.value: A value of true will cause both and to be temporarily set to true during printing operations.

member.name: F:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl._isPrintKeepAspectRatio
member.summary: private field that determines whether or not the visible aspect ratio of the will be preserved when printing this .

member.name: F:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl._isPrintFillPage
member.summary: private field that determines whether or not the dimensions will be expanded to fill the available space when printing this .
member.remarks: If is also true, then the dimensions will be expanded to fit as large a space as possible while still honoring the visible aspect ratio.

member.name: F:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl._pointDateFormat
member.summary: private field that determines the format for displaying tooltip date values. This format is passed to . Use the public property to access this value.

member.name: F:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl._isEnableVZoom
member.summary: private value that determines whether or not zooming is enabled for the control in the vertical direction. Use the public property to access this value.

member.name: F:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl._isEnableHZoom
member.summary: private value that determines whether or not zooming is enabled for the control in the horizontal direction. Use the public property to access this value.

member.name: F:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl._isEnableWheelZoom
member.summary: private value that determines whether or not zooming is enabled with the mousewheel. Note that this property is used in combination with the and properties to control zoom options.

member.name: F:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl._isEnableVEdit
member.summary: private value that determines whether or not point editing is enabled in the vertical direction. Use the public property to access this value.

member.name: F:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl._isEnableHEdit
member.summary: private value that determines whether or not point editing is enabled in the horizontal direction. Use the public property to access this value.

member.name: F:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl._isEnableHPan
member.summary: private value that determines whether or not panning is allowed for the control in the horizontal direction. Use the public property to access this value.

member.name: F:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl._isEnableVPan
member.summary: private value that determines whether or not panning is allowed for the control in the vertical direction. Use the public property to access this value.

member.name: F:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl._isEnableSelection
member.summary: Internal variable that indicates if the control can manage selections.

member.name: F:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl._pdSave
member.summary: private field that stores a instance, which maintains a persistent selection of printer options.
member.remarks: This is needed so that a "Print" action utilizes the settings from a prior "Page Setup" action.

member.name: M:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.AxisChange
member.summary: This performs an axis change command on the graphPane.
member.remarks: This is the same as ZedGraphControl.GraphPane.AxisChange( ZedGraphControl.CreateGraphics() ), however, this method also calls if is true.

member.name: M:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.ZoomStateSave(ZedGraph.GraphPane,ZedGraph.ZoomState.StateType)
member.summary: Save the current states of the GraphPanes to a separate collection. Save a single () GraphPane if the panes are not synchronized (see and ), or save a list of states for all GraphPanes if the panes are synchronized.
member.param: The primary GraphPane on which zoom/pan/scroll operations are taking place
The that describes the current operation

member.name: M:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.ZoomStateRestore(ZedGraph.GraphPane)
member.summary: Restore the states of the GraphPanes to a previously saved condition (via . This is essentially an "undo" for live pan and scroll actions. Restores a single () GraphPane if the panes are not synchronized (see and ), or save a list of states for all GraphPanes if the panes are synchronized.
member.param: The primary GraphPane on which zoom/pan/scroll operations are taking place

member.name: M:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.ZoomStatePush(ZedGraph.GraphPane)
member.summary: Place the previously saved states of the GraphPanes on the individual GraphPane collections. This provides for an option to undo the state change at a later time. Save a single () GraphPane if the panes are not synchronized (see and ), or save a list of states for all GraphPanes if the panes are synchronized.
member.param: The primary GraphPane on which zoom/pan/scroll operations are taking place

member.name: M:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.ZoomStateClear
member.summary: Clear the collection of saved states.

member.name: M:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.ZoomStatePurge
member.summary: Clear all states from the undo stack for each GraphPane.

member.name: T:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.ZedMouseEventHandler
member.summary: A delegate that allows notification of mouse events on Graph objects.
member.param: The source object
A corresponding to this event
member.returns: Return true if you have handled the mouse event entirely, and you do not want the to do any further action (e.g., starting a zoom operation). Return false if ZedGraph should go ahead and process the mouse event.

member.name: E:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.MouseDownEvent
member.summary: Subscribe to this event to provide notification of MouseDown clicks on graph objects
member.remarks: This event provides for a notification when the mouse is clicked on an object within any of the associated with this . This event will use the method to determine which object was clicked. The boolean value that you return from this handler determines whether or not the will do any further handling of the MouseDown event (see ). Return true if you have handled the MouseDown event entirely, and you do not want the to do any further action (e.g., starting a zoom operation). Return false if ZedGraph should go ahead and process the MouseDown event.

member.name: E:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.MouseDown
member.summary: Hide the standard control MouseDown event so that the ZedGraphControl.MouseDownEvent can be used. This is so that the user must return true/false in order to indicate whether or not we should respond to the event.

member.name: E:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.MouseUp
member.summary: Hide the standard control MouseUp event so that the ZedGraphControl.MouseUpEvent can be used. This is so that the user must return true/false in order to indicate whether or not we should respond to the event.

member.name: E:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.MouseMove
member.summary: Hide the standard control MouseMove event so that the ZedGraphControl.MouseMoveEvent can be used. This is so that the user must return true/false in order to indicate whether or not we should respond to the event.

member.name: E:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.MouseUpEvent
member.summary: Subscribe to this event to provide notification of MouseUp clicks on graph objects
member.remarks: This event provides for a notification when the mouse is clicked on an object within any of the associated with this . This event will use the method to determine which object was clicked. The boolean value that you return from this handler determines whether or not the will do any further handling of the MouseUp event (see ). Return true if you have handled the MouseUp event entirely, and you do not want the to do any further action (e.g., starting a zoom operation). Return false if ZedGraph should go ahead and process the MouseUp event.

member.name: E:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.MouseMoveEvent
member.summary: Subscribe to this event to provide notification of MouseMove events over graph objects
member.remarks: This event provides for a notification when the mouse is moving over on the control. The boolean value that you return from this handler determines whether or not the will do any further handling of the MouseMove event (see ). Return true if you have handled the MouseMove event entirely, and you do not want the to do any further action. Return false if ZedGraph should go ahead and process the MouseMove event.

member.name: E:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.DoubleClickEvent
member.summary: Subscribe to this event to provide notification of Double Clicks on graph objects
member.remarks: This event provides for a notification when the mouse is double-clicked on an object within any of the associated with this . This event will use the method to determine which object was clicked. The boolean value that you return from this handler determines whether or not the will do any further handling of the DoubleClick event (see ). Return true if you have handled the DoubleClick event entirely, and you do not want the to do any further action. Return false if ZedGraph should go ahead and process the DoubleClick event.

member.name: T:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.LinkEventHandler
member.summary: A delegate that allows notification of clicks on ZedGraph objects that have active links enabled
member.param: The source object
The source in which the click occurred.
The source object which was clicked. This is typically a type of if a curve point was clicked, or a type of if a graph object was clicked.
The object, belonging to , that contains the link information
An index value, typically used if a was clicked, indicating the ordinal value of the actual point that was clicked.
member.returns: Return true if you have handled the LinkEvent entirely, and you do not want the to do any further action. Return false if ZedGraph should go ahead and process the LinkEvent.

member.name: E:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.LinkEvent
member.summary: Subscribe to this event to be able to respond to mouse clicks within linked objects.
member.remarks: Linked objects are typically either type objects or type objects. These object types can include hyperlink information allowing for "drill-down" type operation.

member.name: M:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.ZoomPane(ZedGraph.GraphPane,System.Double,System.Drawing.PointF,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Zoom a specified pane in or out according to the specified zoom fraction.
member.remarks: The zoom will occur on the , , and only if the corresponding flag, or , is true. Note that if there are multiple Y or Y2 axes, all of them will be zoomed.
member.param: The instance to be zoomed.
The fraction by which to zoom, less than 1 to zoom in, greater than 1 to zoom out. For example, 0.9 will zoom in such that the scale is 90% of what it was originally.
The screen position about which the zoom will be centered. This value is only used if is true.
true to cause the zoom to be centered on the point , false to center on the .
true to force a refresh of the control, false to leave it unrefreshed

member.name: M:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.ZoomPane(ZedGraph.GraphPane,System.Double,System.Drawing.PointF,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Zoom a specified pane in or out according to the specified zoom fraction.
member.remarks: The zoom will occur on the , , and only if the corresponding flag, or , is true. Note that if there are multiple Y or Y2 axes, all of them will be zoomed.
member.param: The instance to be zoomed.
The fraction by which to zoom, less than 1 to zoom in, greater than 1 to zoom out. For example, 0.9 will zoom in such that the scale is 90% of what it was originally.
The screen position about which the zoom will be centered. This value is only used if is true.
true to cause the zoom to be centered on the point , false to center on the .

member.name: M:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.ZoomScale(ZedGraph.Axis,System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Zoom the specified axis by the specified amount, with the center of the zoom at the (optionally) specified point.
member.remarks: This method is used for MouseWheel zoom operations
member.param: The to be zoomed.
The zoom fraction, less than 1.0 to zoom in, greater than 1.0 to zoom out. That is, a value of 0.9 will zoom in such that the scale length is 90% of what it previously was.
The location for the center of the zoom. This is only used if is true.
true if the zoom is to be centered at the screen position, false for the zoom to be centered within the .

member.name: M:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.PanScale(ZedGraph.Axis,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Handle a panning operation for the specified .
member.param: The to be panned
The value where the pan started. The scale range will be shifted by the difference between and .
The value where the pan ended. The scale range will be shifted by the difference between and .

member.name: M:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.CalcZoomRect(System.Drawing.Point,System.Drawing.Point)
member.summary: Caclulates the between two points for zooming.
member.param: The first point.
The second point.
member.returns: The rectangle between the two points.

member.name: P:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.ZoomButtons
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines which mouse button will be used as a primary option to trigger a zoom event.
member.remarks: This value is combined with to determine the actual zoom combination. A secondary zoom button/key combination option is available via and . To not use this button/key combination, set the value of to .

member.name: P:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.ZoomButtons2
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines which mouse button will be used as the secondary option to trigger a zoom event.
member.remarks: This value is combined with to determine the actual zoom combination. The primary zoom button/key combination option is available via and . To not use this button/key combination, set the value of to .

member.name: P:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.ZoomModifierKeys
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines which modifier keys will be used as a primary option to trigger a zoom event.
member.remarks: This value is combined with to determine the actual zoom combination. A secondary zoom button/key combination option is available via and . To not use this button/key combination, set the value of to .

member.name: P:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.ZoomModifierKeys2
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines which modifier keys will be used as a secondary option to trigger a zoom event.
member.remarks: This value is combined with to determine the actual zoom combination. A primary zoom button/key combination option is available via and . To not use this button/key combination, set the value of to .

member.name: P:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.MasterPane
member.summary: Gets or sets the property for the control

member.name: P:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.GraphPane
member.summary: Gets or sets the property for the control
member.remarks: actually uses a object to hold a list of objects. This property really only accesses the first in the list. If there is more than one , use the indexer property to access any of the objects.

member.name: P:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.IsAntiAlias
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines if all drawing operations for this control will be forced to operate in Anti-alias mode. Note that if this value is set to "true", it overrides the setting for sub-objects. Otherwise, the sub-object settings (such as ) will be honored.

member.name: P:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.IsShowPointValues
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether or not tooltips will be displayed when the mouse hovers over data values.
member.remarks: The displayed values are taken from if it is a type, or otherwise (using the as a format string). Additionally, the user can custom format the values using the event. Note that may be overridden by .

member.name: P:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.IsShowCursorValues
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether or not tooltips will be displayed showing the current scale values when the mouse is within the .
member.remarks: The displayed values are taken from the current mouse position, and formatted according to and/or . If this value is set to true, it overrides the setting.

member.name: P:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.IsEnableHEdit
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether or not editing of point data is allowed in the horizontal direction.
member.remarks: Editing is done by holding down the Alt key, and left-clicking on an individual point of a given to drag it to a new location. The Mouse and Key combination for this mode are modifiable using and .

member.name: P:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.IsEnableVEdit
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether or not editing of point data is allowed in the vertical direction.
member.remarks: Editing is done by holding down the Alt key, and left-clicking on an individual point of a given to drag it to a new location. The Mouse and Key combination for this mode are modifiable using and .

member.name: P:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.IsEnableZoom
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether or not zooming is allowed for the control.
member.remarks: Zooming is done by left-clicking inside the to drag out a rectangle, indicating the new scale ranges that will be part of the graph.

member.name: P:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.IsEnableHZoom
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether or not zooming is allowed for the control in the horizontal direction.
member.remarks: Zooming is done by left-clicking inside the to drag out a rectangle, indicating the new scale ranges that will be part of the graph.

member.name: P:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.IsEnableVZoom
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether or not zooming is allowed for the control in the vertical direction.
member.remarks: Zooming is done by left-clicking inside the to drag out a rectangle, indicating the new scale ranges that will be part of the graph.

member.name: P:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.IsEnableWheelZoom
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether or not zooming is allowed via the mouse wheel.
member.remarks: Wheel zooming is done by rotating the mouse wheel. Note that this property is used in combination with the and properties to control zoom options.

member.name: P:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.IsEnableHPan
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether or not panning is allowed for the control in the horizontal direction.
member.remarks: Panning is done by clicking the middle mouse button (or holding down the shift key while clicking the left mouse button) inside the and dragging the mouse around to shift the scale ranges as desired.

member.name: P:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.IsEnableVPan
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether or not panning is allowed for the control in the vertical direction.
member.remarks: Panning is done by clicking the middle mouse button (or holding down the shift key while clicking the left mouse button) inside the and dragging the mouse around to shift the scale ranges as desired.

member.name: P:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.IsShowContextMenu
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether or not the context menu will be available.
member.remarks: The context menu is a menu that appears when you right-click on the . It provides options for Zoom, Pan, AutoScale, Clipboard Copy, and toggle .
member.value: true to allow the context menu, false to disable it

member.name: P:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.IsShowCopyMessage
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether or not a message box will be shown in response to a context menu "Copy" command.
member.remarks: Note that, if this property is set to false, the user will receive no indicative feedback in response to a Copy action.

member.name: P:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.SaveFileDialog
member.summary: Gets or sets the instance that will be used by the "Save As..." context menu item.
member.remarks: This provides the opportunity to modify the dialog, such as setting the property.

member.name: P:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.IsPrintKeepAspectRatio
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether or not the visible aspect ratio of the will be preserved when printing this .

member.name: P:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.IsPrintFillPage
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether or not the dimensions will be expanded to fill the available space when printing this .
member.remarks: If is also true, then the dimensions will be expanded to fit as large a space as possible while still honoring the visible aspect ratio.

member.name: P:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.IsPrintScaleAll
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether the settings of and will be overridden to true during printing operations.
member.remarks: Printing involves pixel maps that are typically of a dramatically different dimension than on-screen pixel maps. Therefore, it becomes more important to scale the fonts and lines to give a printed image that looks like what is shown on-screen. The default setting for is true, but the default setting for is false.
member.value: A value of true will cause both and to be temporarily set to true during printing operations.

member.name: P:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.IsAutoScrollRange
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that controls whether or not the axis value range for the scroll bars will be set automatically.
member.remarks:
If this value is set to true, then the range of the scroll bars will be set automatically to the actual range of the data as returned by at the time that was last called. Note that a value of true can override any setting of , , , , , and . Note also that you must call from the for this to work properly (e.g., don't call it directly from the . Alternatively, you can call at anytime to set the scroll bar range.
In most cases, you will probably want to disable before activating this option.

member.name: P:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.ScrollGrace
member.summary: Set a "grace" value that leaves a buffer area around the data when is true.
member.remarks: This value represents a fraction of the total range around each axis. For example, if the axis ranges from 0 to 100, then a 0.05 value for ScrollGrace would set the scroll range to -5 to 105.

member.name: P:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.IsShowHScrollBar
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines if the horizontal scroll bar will be visible.
member.remarks:
This scroll bar allows the display to be scrolled in the horizontal direction. Another option is display panning, in which the user can move the display around by clicking directly on it and dragging (see and ). You can control the available range of scrolling with the and properties. Note that the scroll range can be set automatically by .
In most cases, you will probably want to disable before activating this option.
member.value: A boolean value. true to display a horizontal scrollbar, false otherwise.

member.name: P:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.IsShowVScrollBar
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines if the vertical scroll bar will be visible.
member.remarks:
This scroll bar allows the display to be scrolled in the vertical direction. Another option is display panning, in which the user can move the display around by clicking directly on it and dragging (see and ). You can control the available range of scrolling with the and properties. Note that the vertical scroll bar only affects the ; it has no impact on the . The panning options affect both the and . Note also that the scroll range can be set automatically by .
In most cases, you will probably want to disable before activating this option.
member.value: A boolean value. true to display a vertical scrollbar, false otherwise.

member.name: P:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.IsSynchronizeXAxes
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines if the ranges for all objects in the will be forced to match.
member.remarks: If set to true (default is false), then all of the objects in the associated with this will be forced to have matching scale ranges for the x axis. That is, zoom, pan, and scroll operations will result in zoom/pan/scroll for all graphpanes simultaneously.

member.name: P:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.IsSynchronizeYAxes
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines if the ranges for all objects in the will be forced to match.
member.remarks: If set to true (default is false), then all of the objects in the associated with this will be forced to have matching scale ranges for the y axis. That is, zoom, pan, and scroll operations will result in zoom/pan/scroll for all graphpanes simultaneously.

member.name: P:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.IsScrollY2
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines if the vertical scroll bar will affect the Y2 axis.
member.remarks: The vertical scroll bar is automatically associated with the Y axis. With this value, you can choose to include or exclude the Y2 axis with the scrolling. Note that the Y2 axis scrolling is handled as a secondary. The vertical scroll bar position always reflects the status of the Y axis. This can cause the Y2 axis to "jump" when first scrolled if the and values are not set to the same proportions as and with respect to the actual and . Also note that this property is actually just an alias to the property of the first element of .

member.name: P:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.YScrollRangeList
member.summary: Access the for the Y axes.
member.remarks: This list maintains the user scale ranges for the scroll bars for each axis in the . Each ordinal location in corresponds to an equivalent ordinal location in .

member.name: P:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.Y2ScrollRangeList
member.summary: Access the for the Y2 axes.
member.remarks: This list maintains the user scale ranges for the scroll bars for each axis in the . Each ordinal location in corresponds to an equivalent ordinal location in .

member.name: P:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.ScrollMinX
member.summary: The minimum value for the X axis scroll range.
member.remarks: Effectively, the minimum endpoint of the scroll range will cause the value to be set to . Note that this value applies only to the scroll bar settings. Axis panning (see ) is not affected by this value. Note that this value can be overridden by and .
member.value: A double value indicating the minimum axis value

member.name: P:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.ScrollMaxX
member.summary: The maximum value for the X axis scroll range.
member.remarks: Effectively, the maximum endpoint of the scroll range will cause the value to be set to . Note that this value applies only to the scroll bar settings. Axis panning (see ) is not affected by this value. Note that this value can be overridden by and .
member.value: A double value indicating the maximum axis value

member.name: P:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.ScrollMinY
member.summary: The minimum value for the Y axis scroll range.
member.remarks: Effectively, the minimum endpoint of the scroll range will cause the value to be set to . Note that this value applies only to the scroll bar settings. Axis panning (see ) is not affected by this value. Note that this value can be overridden by and . Also note that this property is actually just an alias to the property of the first element of .
member.value: A double value indicating the minimum axis value

member.name: P:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.ScrollMaxY
member.summary: The maximum value for the Y axis scroll range.
member.remarks: Effectively, the maximum endpoint of the scroll range will cause the value to be set to . Note that this value applies only to the scroll bar settings. Axis panning (see ) is not affected by this value. Note that this value can be overridden by and . Also note that this property is actually just an alias to the property of the first element of .
member.value: A double value indicating the maximum axis value

member.name: P:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.ScrollMinY2
member.summary: The minimum value for the Y2 axis scroll range.
member.remarks: Effectively, the minimum endpoint of the scroll range will cause the value to be set to . Note that this value applies only to the scroll bar settings. Axis panning (see ) is not affected by this value. Note that this value can be overridden by and . Also note that this property is actually just an alias to the property of the first element of .
member.value: A double value indicating the minimum axis value

member.name: P:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.ScrollMaxY2
member.summary: The maximum value for the Y2 axis scroll range.
member.remarks: Effectively, the maximum endpoint of the scroll range will cause the value to be set to . Note that this value applies only to the scroll bar settings. Axis panning (see ) is not affected by this value. Note that this value can be overridden by and . Also note that this property is actually just an alias to the property of the first element of .
member.value: A double value indicating the maximum axis value

member.name: P:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.IsScrolling
member.summary: Returns true if the user is currently scrolling via the scrollbar, or false if no scrolling is taking place.
member.remarks: This method just tests ScrollBar.Capture to see if the mouse has been captured by the scroll bar. If so, scrolling is active.

member.name: P:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.PointValueFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the format for displaying tooltip values. This format is passed to .
member.remarks: Use the type to determine the format strings.

member.name: P:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.PointDateFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the format for displaying tooltip values. This format is passed to .
member.remarks: Use the type to determine the format strings.

member.name: P:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.ZoomStepFraction
member.summary: Gets or sets the step size fraction for zooming with the mouse wheel. A value of 0.1 will result in a 10% zoom step for each mouse wheel movement.

member.name: P:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.IsZoomOnMouseCenter
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value that determines if zooming with the wheel mouse is centered on the mouse location, or centered on the existing graph.

member.name: M:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.GetImage
member.summary: Gets the graph pane's current image.
member.exception: When the control has been disposed before this call.

member.name: P:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.BeenDisposed
member.summary: This checks if the control has been disposed. This is synonymous with the graph pane having been nulled or disposed. Therefore this is the same as ZedGraphControl.GraphPane == null.

member.name: P:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.Selection
member.summary: Readonly property that gets the list of selected CurveItems

member.name: M:ZedGraph.ZedGraphControl.SetScrollRangeFromData
member.summary: Sets the value of the scroll range properties (see , , , and based on the actual range of the data for each corresponding .
member.remarks:
This method is called automatically by if
is true. Note that this will not be called if you call AxisChange directly from the . For example, zedGraphControl1.AxisChange() works properly, but zedGraphControl1.GraphPane.AxisChange() does not.
